title.narrative: OGB S. Africa Davos Week of Action 2018

description.narrative: As the notorious gathering of some of the richest and most powerful person in Davos for the annual World Economic Forum takes place, Oxfam, partners and CSOs across regions and countries are responding to the Fight Inequality Alliance#s call for a Week of Action from the 19th to 26th January to mobilize across the world to highlight the crisis of inequality and to demonstrate that people are already organizing to demand a more equal society. Inequality has become one of the biggest economic, social, and political challenges of our time. The aim of this Week of Action is to show the global public that the answers to address this complex challenge do not only come from those elites; that instead the way to tackle inequality is through strengthening the power of ordinary people to organize for change. A kaleidoscope of marches, outdoor music events, people#s assemblies, travelling sound trucks, and stunts, as well as personal stories of why inequality matters and why people are fighting it will be captured and told during this week. The lack of representation and participation of community members across the global village in platforms and moments such as World Economic Forum in Davos, highlights the extent of fragmentation in our societies. It#s therefore within this context that Oxfam South Africa and partners aim to bring the World Economic Forum in Davos to community level through hosting an #Imbizo# (social discussion forum) around inequality in South Africa, a visual demonstration and travelling sound truck during the Week of Action in a community affected by adverse poverty and inequality. Via these activities, we aim to increase public participation in global economic events by hosting a panel discussion led by community members on inequality inSouth Africa. No form of economic or social justice can be achievedif multi stakeholder discussions do not include the participation of the affected. We also aim to confronting inequality through aninteractive game of an inequality tug of war, to visually represent the struggle between the rich and the poor and the unfair distribution of power that accompanies inequality. Finally, we expect to give visibility to inequality topics through a travelling sound truck that will broadcast key highlights from Davos, key messages from Oxfam#s inequality report and quick facts from inequality research from partners and other civil society organizations. The action will provide the platform to catalyse the discussion around inequality and increase support from communities on the fight to end inequality, as politicians, the elite and world leaders gather inDavos, we will encourage communities, members of society to come together to share ideas, policy suggestions and solutions on how to transform the current economy into a more human economy.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam South Africa is an independent Oxfam affiliate who manages and implements the programme of Oxfam in South Africa. Its programme prioritises vulnerable communities and creating lasting change in, and for all the people in South Africa. Oxfam South Africa works in partnership with organisations who seek to create meaningful and sustainable change that benefits vulnerable groups in South Africa through the attainment, protection and preservation of human rights and social justice. The country program will continue to focus its work through ‘active citizenship and accountability’ and ‘gender justice’ lenses.
